settings.title: Meet the Artist
settings.text:
I'm a ceramic artist based in Lake Stevens, Washington, where I create functional pottery in my home studio. My journey with clay began several years ago as a way to slow down and create something beautiful with my hands.

Working from my small studio, I throw each piece individually on the pottery wheel, taking time to ensure every curve and line feels just right. There's something magical about transforming a lump of clay into something that will be used and loved in someone's home.

settings.title: The Process
settings.text:
Each piece begins as a ball of clay centered on my pottery wheel. I throw the basic form, then spend time refining the shape, adding details, and ensuring the proportions feel balanced. After the initial throwing, pieces need to dry slowly for 1-2 weeks.

Once leather-hard, I trim the bottoms, add any final details, and apply my signature stamp. The pieces then go through their first firing (bisque) at about 1800°F, followed by glazing and a final firing at 2232°F.

This process takes 3-4 weeks for each piece, but the result is pottery that's both beautiful and built to last generations.

settings.title: Small Batch Philosophy
settings.text:
I intentionally keep my production small - usually 50-70 pieces per month. This allows me to focus on quality over quantity, ensuring each piece meets my standards for both function and beauty.

When you purchase from Burn Road Ceramics, you're not just buying pottery - you're supporting a small business and getting a piece that was made with intention and care.
